intro: Spigelia stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf spigelia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of tubular, red-orange flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are narrow and opposite, often with a slightly hairy texture. Spigelia stenophylla is adapted to moist, sandy soils and is often found in pine flatwoods and wetlands.
